Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule R 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/14/24, a staff member hit and scratched a youth at the
facility resulting in marks on the back of the right shoulder/neck
area.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 09/23/2024. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another Department of Health and Human
(DHHS) worker. Youth A stated she was on a one staff to one
youth ratio with Staff 1 on Albert Cleage unit. Youth A stated she
heard and smelled Staff 1 take a bowel movement in Room 3.
Youth A stated Staff 1 came out of Room 3 and she asked Staff 1
and Staff 1 said, “Yeah, I pooped.” Youth A stated she planned on
wearing a sweatshirt that was hanging on the back of a chair, but
Staff 1 touched the sweatshirt and she did not wash her hands
after using the bathroom. Youth A stated she knew Staff 1 did not
wash her hands because the sink in Room 3 was dry and there
was no soap by the sink. Youth A stated she grabbed her
sweatshirt from Staff 1 and pushed Staff 1 for touching her
sweatshirt. Youth A stated Staff 1 fell to the ground, got up and
grabbed Youth A’s hair. Youth A stated she grabbed Staff 1’s hair
in return and Staff 1 scratched Youth A’s shoulder when they
tussled. Youth A stated she pushed the intercom button by the
unit’s entrance door and called for help. Youth A stated Clinical
Manager and Supervisor came to the unit and Nurse also came.
Youth A stated the scratches healed and she did not want to
remove her sweatshirt to verify the scratch marks healed on her
shoulder area. The other DHHS worker in this interview met with
Youth A on 09/17/2024 and observed Youth A with multiple
2

scratch marks on the back of her left shoulder and a scratch mark
below her left shoulder closer to the bottom of her armpit.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated she was
assigned as Youth A’s one staff to one youth ratio on 09/14/2024
on Albert Cleage unit. Staff 1 stated Youth A was the only youth
placed on this unit of six beds. Staff 1 stated she used one of the
toilets in an empty youth room because she did not get a
response from a supervisor for staff coverage to leave the unit to
use the bathroom. Staff 1 stated she believed this would be alright
because Youth A was the only youth on the unit and she would
leave the room door cracked open. Staff 1 admitted that she did
not wash her hands afterwards because there was no soap and
no paper towel in the room. Staff 1 stated she used hand sanitizer
like the small bottle she had clipped to her belt during the
interview. Staff 1 stated Youth A said, “You shitted, Don’t touch
anything” and snatched her folded clothes from Staff 1. Staff 1
stated Youth A banged on a door and Staff 1 redirected Youth A
to put on her clothes. Staff 1 stated Youth A approached her,
kicked her and Staff 1 fell down when her back hit the wall. Staff 1
stated she got up and Youth A kicked her again and she went to
the ground. Staff 1 stated she got up and tried to restrain Youth A,
but they ended up pulling each other’s hair. Staff 1 stated her nails
were bitten down and jagged during this incident causing her to
unintentionally scratch Youth A’s arms. Staff 1 stated Youth A
scratched the left side of Staff 1’s face during their tussle. Staff 1
stated Youth A pushed the intercom button by the unit’s entrance
door and assistance came. Staff 1 stated she left the unit for the
remainder of the shift. Staff 1 stated she has not worked on a unit
since 09/14/2024, but was assigned to the key room.
Clinical Manager was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Clinical
Manager stated she responded to an assistance call. Clinical
Manager stated when she arrived on the unit, Youth A was irate
and crouched down in a corner. Clinical Manager stated she de-
escalated and refocused Youth A to baseline. Clinical Manager
stated she called for a nurse to evaluate the scratch marks on the
back of Youth A’s shoulder area.
Supervisor was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor stated
she responded to an assistance call and saw Staff 1 standing in
front of Youth A, who was naked and yelling, when she arrived on
the unit. Supervisor stated Staff 1 told her that Youth A assaulted
3

her. Supervisor stated Staff 1’s hair looked disheveled with hair
pulled out of her ponytail. Supervisor stated she directed Staff 1 to
leave the unit to de-escalate Youth A. Supervisor stated she
noticed Youth A with blood and scratches on her shoulder and
asked what happened. Supervisor stated Staff 1 came back to the
unit door and stated Youth A scratched herself, which caused
Youth A to escalate again. Supervisor stated Nurse came to the
unit and evaluated Youth A. Supervisor stated she assigned
another staff to work with Youth A for the remainder of the shift.
Supervisor Trainee was interviewed on 10/03/2024 by phone
because he resigned from Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
09/26/2024. Supervisor Trainee stated he responded to an
assistance call, but the incident between Youth A and Staff 1 was
over when he arrived on the unit. Supervisor Trainee stated he
excused himself from the unit because Supervisor was already on
the unit de-escalating Youth A and Youth A was naked.
Nurse was interviewed on 10/31/2024 by phone. Nurse recalled
evaluating Youth A for an incident involving Staff 1. Nurse stated
Youth A had superficial scratch marks on her arm and back.
Nurse stated the scratches were cleaned and bacitracin applied.
Nurse stated to review her medical progress note for additional
information because the incident occurred several week ago.
Video
09/14/2024 Albert Cleage unit video starting at 6:39 PM shows
Youth A standing at the unit’s entrance door naked. Youth A
throws something (possibly a television remote) and Staff 1 gets
up from her chair and picks up the item. Staff 1 then picks up
some clothing laying on a chair. Youth A runs and pushes Staff 1.
Staff 1 falls to the ground, gets up and reaches towards Youth A’s
neck and shoulders with her hands. Youth A pushes Staff 1. Staff
1 falls to the ground and hits the back of her head against the wall.
Staff 1 gets up. Youth A and Staff 1 face each other while
grabbing and holding onto each other’s hair and engaged in a
tussle. Youth A releases her hold on Staff 1 and uses the one-way
window on the unit like a mirror to look at her shoulders. Youth A
walks to the unit’s entrance door and pushes the intercom button.
Assistance arrives and the incident ends at 6:44 PM. Video
recording does not have sound.
Documentation
Deputy Director stated by email on 09/23/2024 and 10/14/2024
that an incident report documenting the physical altercation
between Youth A and Staff 1 on 09/14/2024 does not exist.
4

Medical progress note dated 09/14/2024 states Youth A stood
naked in the middle of the unit and yelled at Staff 1 and Clinical
Manager. Nurse wrote Youth A had multiple scratches on the left
side of her neck, left upper arm and the middle of her back. Nurse
wrote the scratches were cleaned with saline and bacitracin and
band aids applied. Nurse wrote Youth A denied pain to the
scratched areas.
Staff 1 completed Handle with Care training on 04/11/2024. Staff 1
does not have a discipline history.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance when Staff 1 pulled Youth
A’s hair and scratched Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Investigation Additional Finding 1
Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated she wrote an
incident report about her physical altercation with Youth A under a
supervisor’s name but does not recall which supervisor’s name.
Staff 1 stated Albert Cleage unit did not have a logbook to
document the physical altercation between her and Youth A and
her one staff to one youth activities with Youth A on 09/14/2024.
Documentation
Deputy Director responded by email on 09/23/2024 that an
incident report about Youth A and Staff 1’s physical altercation
does not exist.
5

Deputy Director responded by email on 10/15/2024 that an
incident report about Youth A and Staff 1’s physical altercation
written under a supervisor’s name does not exist.
Albert Cleage logbook was reviewed from 09/10/2024 to
09/15/2024. Documentation for 09/14/2024 is absent from the
logbook.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Incident Report Rationale
policy and procedure 6.1 states incident reports are entered in the
system before the end of the shift that the incident occurred. It
also states a supervisor ensures the incident report is written and
entered into the system.
Additional Finding 2
Interview
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated she was
assigned as Youth A’s one staff to one youth ratio on 09/14/2024
on Albert Cleage unit. Staff 1 stated during the shift she needed to
use the bathroom and was unable to reach a supervisor to obtain
staff coverage. Staff 1 stated she decided to use the toilet in an
empty youth room. Staff 1 stated she believed this would be
acceptable because Youth A was the only youth on the unit and
she left the door cracked open. (Staff 1 would have locked herself
in the youth room if the door was completely closed.)
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention policy and procedure 10.24
Youth Movement and Supervision states “3. When moving from
one area to another, the JDS shall position themselves where they
can maintain “line-of sight” supervision and control of the group.”
Analysis Additional Finding 1
The agency is found in non-compliance of their policy and
procedure when the Deputy Director was unable to locate an
incident report about Youth A and Staff 1’s physical altercation.
Staff are to write an incident report prior to the end of their shift,
which the incident occurred, and a supervisor is to ensure the
incident report was completed.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Albert Cleage logbook entries for 09/14/2024 does not exist.
Some type of documentation is needed for record keeping.
Additional Finding 2
6

The agency is found in non-compliance in providing line of sight
supervision when Staff 1 entered an empty youth room leaving
Youth A in the common area by herself
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
